alert.note: Alert for Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 13 at 8:03PM CDT until April 14 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 9 PM CDT FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... ...RED FLAG WARNING IS CANCELLED FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 1 PM to 9 PM CDT Friday. The Red Flag Warning for this evening has been cancelled. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron and Texas. In Texas... Dallam...Sherman...Hansford...Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson... Oldham...Potter...Deaf Smith...Randall and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 9 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...2 to 5. * Timing...12 PM through 9 PM CDT Friday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
